I have used this app in my phone for over a year. It always worked fine there. It also installed fine in my Ubuntu 19.10 using snap via terminal: 'sudo snap install bluemail ' command.
I also used Mailspring for the last two years, but after numerous UNSUCCESSFUL trials to sync to my Yahoo accounts via imap I finally decided to give BlueMail a trial under Ubuntu, so far so good. The interface is slick and emails come and go immediately, whereas Mailspring was fetching emails for a while before I was able to see them in my mailbox.
In a nutshell, this could be a good choice email client for Ubuntu and other Linux distributions. I give a four star and not five because I want to fully test it as my main email client...afterwards, I will be in better position to decide for rating!!
Loads my custom SMTP mail
It was very easy to sync my Office 365 email, even if my university has an integrated way of accessing its IT services which impedes access from other clients like "Thunderbird".
Microsoft with all of its faults really created a great app in Outlook. This application works very similar to Outlook. The SNAP install has worked will on my 19.04 installation.
summary: Almost is nice as MS Outlook

description: Fantastic layout. My preference above that of the likes of Thunderbird! I use it on Windows, Android and Linux.

Still early development, but if will be introduced all features available on android it could be one of the best mail clients for Linux distributions.
Really useful that it can configure automatically mail server for all most providers
Better than most other Linux Mail Clients I have tried

description: Used it on 18.04 and now on 20.04. For me it's best destop mail app for Ubuntu. Working with Microsoft Exchange like a charm.
I wish I tried this app first! It just worked when I set it up. No addins that cost money. No hassle. Looks modern and nice! Thunderbird is good, but OWL addin costs.
summary: This just works, looks better, and was easy to set up

description: Just swapped out Thunderbird and Geary for Bluemail. I am running Lubuntu, and it works without any issues. Can add any IMAP account my heart desires. Have not tested it with POP3.

I have tried Bluemail a couple of times on Ubuntu. Initially it seems OK, but it regularly freezes for up to 5 minutes, and the address book is hopeless if you more than one email account in use. Each email account has a different address book. It also needs some kind of Spam filtering and to be able to setup filters if it is to be a viable alternative to Thunderbird. 

Overall, it needs a lot more work, it isn't stable and lacks essential features.
summary: Good be good, but it needs a lot more work

description:
Of all the email apps Buemail looks great and the unified inbox does work. It allows me to switch accounts. All the standard options such as signatures are present and work as you'd expect.

Hoewever copying/moving mail between accounts is not supported. The account password stored in Ubuntu is not picked up and search is very broken. Most basic search queries give no results whatsoever. I ended up removing this one and going back to Mailspring (which has it's own issues too).
summary: Looks good, functions okay, but many details broken

description:
??? ??? ??? ???? ? ???? ?????? ????? ??????? ???? ???? ???? ???????? ????? ???? ?? ??! I have been struggling to get Akonadi-EWS to work. Even with an outlook.com account it does not work. Even with an office365 account where it seems to work my mail does not show up. With one work Exchange 2016 account it does not work at all. 

The KDE team should see if they can get an open source version of this and adopt it into the program. It feels like a KDE program.
summary: If you use KDE but Kmail Won't Do Exchange

Tried several email clients and tried to get them to work with Exchange accounts usng activesync, all to no avail. Then tried Bluemail, and yes, at last, both Exchange activesync accounts worked flawlessly, as did my GMail account, easy to flip between accounts, and contacts and calendar sync works too. Great App, doesn't use too much resources either when I checked the resource monitor.
summary: Finally - a mail client that works with exchange activesync

description:
Gorgeous looking app, by far my favourite email client.
The problem is is not always reliable. For example it happens daily I can delete email by pressing "delete" for n times, the n+1 time it stops deleting emails for no reason. Sometimes it stops working and emails won't arrive, so I have to restart the app.

Sadly I had to switch back to thinderbird after many months. Looking forward to try it again once issues are fixed

description: completly fuctional

I use Office 365 and IMAP/POP3 is disabled by administrator so I must use EAS (Exchange ActiveSync) so that any device or app is authorized before accessing info. This package handled all the login and authorization process in a clean + easy way. And it's free (will check if I can make a donation after using it for a few more days). I'm quite happy with it
Funktioniert ohne Probleme, ist übersichtlich und einfach zu verstehen.

Toller MailClient, doch leider zu unsicher, da die Mails unverschlüsselt abgefangen werden können.
Wirkt auf mich beinah wie Absicht...
sieht gut aus und einer der wenigen Clients mit zeitgemäßen Design. Leider lässt sich nur ein Fenster zum Erstellen von neuen E-Mails öffnen. Dann kann man gleich über Web-Mail arbeiten,
schnell klein übersichtlich.

Habe diesem Programm gegenüber nichts auszusetzen und bietet all jene Funktionen welche ich von einem E-Mail Programm erwarte oder entsprechend auch nutze. Kann Problemlos meine 2 E-Mail Konten Separat oder gar auch kombiniert nutzen.
Für mich im Augenblick der beste. Maileinrichtung fast völlig automatisch, Kalender findet er auch von selbst. Da kommen viele nicht mit. Bisher keine abstürze oder ähnliches. Geht nur 5 Sterne
zu langsam und stürzt viel ab
Hab ihn seiit einer Weile in Gebrauch. Der Junk-Filter funktiioniert besser als bei Springmail. Das war auch der Grund warum ich gewechseelt habe.

Grundsätzlich hält der Client, was er verspricht. Die Oberfläche ist modern und intuitiv. Leider unterstützt BlueMail weder CardDav (für die Synchronisation von Kontkaten), noch GnuPg zur Verschlüsselung. Damit ist der Client für mich leider nicht brauchbar.

+ aufgeräumte Oberfläche
+ mehrere Accounts einfach zu handeln

- ab und zu Springt der Fensterfokus, liegt denke ich am snap Paket
- Schriftgröße in normalen Text-Emails lässt sich nicht ändern

After a quick review...

PROs:
Looks great, easy setup for (3rd party) IMAP Accounts, autodiscovery works like a charm, "Magic Sync" is a killer feature! (like in the Brave browser) but...
CONs:
CalDAV and CardDAV on external Servers (outside the Email-Account) is not supported!

Because of this its not usable for me, at least for now - see it as a feature request ;) ...and if i be so cheeky to ask for another feature request - put in some definitions like for Synology or QNAP NAS - they always use the same pattern, wich is a mix from the url, username ans optional ports.

Its a pitty - but for now i have to stay with good ol' Thunderbird.

THX anyways - keep up the great work! So far its easy a 4 * worth!
Recomendada para Exchenge
Definitivamente el mejor, estuve tratando con varios otros y este me permitio configurar mi correo muy facilmente.
Funciona de mil maravillas, probado usando MS Exchange sobre KDE Neon 5.20

Interfaz limpia y sencilla de utilizar. Integración de Gmail, Hotmail y Exchange perfecta (que yo haya usado). Permite utilizar calendarios, listas de cosas que hacer, etc. Tiene una gran cantidad de funcionalidades.

Sérieusement, c'est une perle ce BlueMail, c'est beau, efficace, multi comptes, gestion des protocoles POP/IMAP/Exchange, SSL, rapide, simple (pas de fioritures, que l'essentiel), filtrage intuitifs, prise en compte des agendas, gestion des tâches.
Ceux qui comme moi n'adèrent pas à l'interface austère de Th...d, je vous invite à essayer cette perle !

description: Ставил как один из немногих клиентов умеющих ActiveSync Exchange . Вот скажите мне, кем надо быть, что бы не предлагать ввести сервер Exchange при заведении учетки? Сооствественно подключится к Exchange не удалось. В топку
Ubuntu 22.04 Программа установилась, но не запустилась
Единственный адекватно работающий с эксчейнджем

Плюсы:
- Завелось всё на Exchange успешно
- Подтянулисась вся почта, контакты и календари

Минусы:
- Интерфейс подтормаживает
- Календарь показывает с 00:00 часов, лучше сделать параметр рабочее время и сразу центировать по нему.
- Не всегда понятно в каком формате улетает письмо, если ты его написал в темной теме.
Моросит и неудобное приложение
Дайте нормальное приложение, это никуда не годится!
